intro: Gaudichaudia hyssopifolia, commonly known as the bluebells of New Zealand, is a flowering plant native to the South Island of New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded areas such as forests and rock crevices. It has small, ovate leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Gaudichaudia hyssopifolia is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
